intro: Aeollanthus quarrei, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the spring and early summer. Aeollanthus quarrei is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
